DataElement.preferredName: Diagnosis Chronic Elevated Virus Level Prior Transplantation Yes No Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Text term to signify whether chronic elevation of viral level(s) was diagnosed prior to a bone marrow transplantation procedure.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Diagnosis Chronic Elevated Virus Level Prior Transplantation Occurrence
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: The investigation, analysis and recognition of the presence and nature of disease, condition, or injury from expressed signs and symptoms; also, the scientific determination of any kind; the concise results of such an investigation._Earlier in time or order._Transference of a tissue or organ within an individual, between individuals of the same species, or between individuals of different species._An instance of something happening, such as an event or incident._Usually used to describe a condition that is persistent and long standing._Raised or increased above normal levels or limits._Minute infectious agents whose genomes are composed of DNA or RNA, but not both. They are characterized by a lack of independent metabolism and the inability to replicate outside living host cells.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: The investigation, analysis and recognition of the presence and nature of disease, condition, or injury from expressed signs and symptoms; also, the scientific determination of any kind; the concise results of such an investigation.:Usually used to describe a condition that is persistent and long standing.:Raised or increased above normal levels or limits.:Minute infectious agents whose genomes are composed of DNA or RNA, but not both. They are characterized by a lack of independent metabolism and the inability to replicate outside living host cells.

Concepts.definition: The investigation, analysis and recognition of the presence and nature of disease, condition, or injury from expressed signs and symptoms; also, the scientific determination of any kind; the concise results of such an investigation.
Usually used to describe a condition that is persistent and long standing.
Raised or increased above normal levels or limits.

An infectious agent which consists of two parts, genetic material and a protein coat. These organisms lack independent metabolism, and they must infect the cells of other types of organisms to reproduce. Most viruses are capable of passing through fine filters that retain bacteria, and are not visible through a light microscope.

Property.preferredDefinition: Earlier in time or order.:Transference of a tissue or organ within an individual, between individuals of the same species, or between individuals of different species.:An instance of something happening, such as an event or incident.

Concepts.definition: Transference of a tissue or organ within an individual, between individuals of the same species, or between individuals of different species.
An instance of something happening, such as an event or incident.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the process of identifying a disease by the signs and symptoms (NCI Glossary).
